newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Devex says year production 25,855 ounces.
newsitem.headline: Devex says year production 25,855 ounces.

text.p: Australian miner Devex Ltd said on Monday it produced 25,855 ounces of gold in the year to June 30 at a cash cost of A$398 per ounce.
Selling gold into forward contracts generated revenue of A$14.7 million at an average A$566 per ounce, for a cash operating surplus of A$4.3 million, it said.
This was reinvested in exploration, development and capital works totalling A$5.9 million.
Devex, which operates the Monkland mine at Queensland's Gympie goldfields, said it planned to reduce cash operating costs to below $A350 per ounce over the next 12 months.
It was budgeting for a cash operating surplus of A$8.7 million at the Monkland Mine in 1997/98, most of which would be reinvested at mine in the exploration.
